comment: A bounded, continuous function on an open bounded interval is integrable. The function must be bounded. For a counterexample, consider ` F = ( x e. ( 0 (,) 1 ) |-> ( 1 / x ) ) ` . See ~ cniccibl for closed bounded intervals. (Contributed by Jon Pennant, 31-May-2019.)
